climbs.name: Toll Road
climbs.fa: Mike Smith and Sam Smolnisky maybe?

content.description: Follow the wide crack in the dihedral to the top.  Such a nice route that it is a mystery why there isn't a tax on it...
content.location: Left around the corner from Ms. U. Marty

climbs.name: Shrek's Revenge
climbs.fa: Mike Smith and Sam Smolnisky maybe?

content.description: Gain the ledge and move left and up following the pair of unequal cracks to the top.
content.protection: the right crack (smaller of the two) protects well using hand sized gear.  Gear anchor up top.
content.location: Located about 30 feet upstream of Tower of the Gods.

content.description: Starts upstream from Green Goblin.  Gain the ledge and move left trying to avoid the dead tree leaning up against the route.  Take the face to the top.
content.location: Located left of Green Goblin.  The route starts just right of the dead tree leaning against the rock.

content.description: This is the direct finish to Pointed Ears Left.  Gain the ledge and struggle up the arete.  Requires long reaches, heel hooks, and good looks
content.location: Start right of the dead tree leaning up against the rock.  Same start as Pointed Ears Left.

content.description: The start of this climb leans back slightly until you gain the ledge.  Move into the hand crack splitting the west face and let it guide you to the top.
content.protection: Finger and hand sized gear.  You can sling some stumps up top for an anchor

content.description: Just left of Out of Sight is a nice, slightly overhanging arete.  Begins with a tough section full of crimps, side pulls and a little bit of footwork.  Eases after awhile.
content.location: Left of Out of Sight, right of Green Goblin

content.description: Start on the platform and negotiate through the overhanging face staying off of the right side of the dihedral.  Once you get to the hand rail, secure the bucket and monkey swing with vigor off left.  Dance your way up the arete to the top.
content.location: left side of the dihedral housing Hobgoblin Hangover

content.description: Close relative, yet secret lover of Mr. E, she lies just to the right of him in a way that is seductive and misleading to the climber's eye.  Ms Tree lewers suiters halfway up her to her pleasing..."side-pulls." Though she may be convincing that protection won't work well here, don't be mistaken! Even your small nuts are better than none! Your heart starts pumping and your vision clouds. You fondle out far with your left and hand and make some progress.  Reaching up right you find her bucket!  If you get scared, make up some excuse like you have a headache and bail right to read the open book. If not, find the climax up through the obviously dirty cleavage...in the ROCK you pervert!
content.protection: tr: gear anchor   lead: small stoppers, maybe RPs, set of cajones and a healthy fear of the lord
content.location: thin seam in the same face and to the right of Mr. E.

content.description: Staying right of the crack and left of the corner you will find a bunch of mini roofs.  Work your way up the narrow face utilizing better holds off left.
Located just around the corner from Gremlins is a delightful little face climb covered with ferns and other interesting plants.  Move up the broken crack searching for protection up the sparse face.
content.protection: There is protection, you just have to get creative.
content.location: Right around the corner from Gremlins

climbs.name: Hobgoblin Hangover
climbs.fa: Jeff Johnson and Nora Olson maybe? but this IS the pal, so probably someone else

content.description: Good (though short) handcrack that pulls a small buldge/overhang into a dihedral. Start in a shallow chimney, spraddle up with great hands. Try not to go right onto the face and into Gremlins (5.6).  Basically, hand jams the whole way with the option to bail right onto Gremlins if cracks aren't your bag.
content.protection: (multiple) BD 2 and/or similar hex(s) for leading. There are stopper placements to the right on Gremlins if you only have small stuff
content.location: Climber's right of sesame street rock about 50ft in the forest. I'm pretty sure its between that and Tower of the God's but I wasn't paying attention. Right facing dihedral above a rock platform that starts w/ a chimney and pulls a buldge via a handcrack

climbs.name: Gremlins
climbs.fa: Jeff Johnson and Sam Smolnisky maybe?

content.description: Climb the seam and gain the top.
content.location: The thin crack on the face a few feet right of Hobgoblin Hangover.

content.description: Start on a west facing greenish face.  There is a broken crack leading up to a small ledge.  Gain the ledge and move right.  Follow the crack to the top.
content.location: Climb is located right of Pointed Ears Direct

content.description: Up series of steps.     Crux for small child is near bottom with long reach for foot placement, but is low enough to boost up.  Good route for small children, but does not proceed straight up, so a fall would result in a swing.
content.protection: Nuts and small to med cams   Top rope to trees past top edge.
content.location: On left side of Hobgoblin's Hideout, just left of Toll Road.   Walk off top or top rope.

climbs.name: da Vine Goblins
climbs.fa: Sam Smolnisky and Jeff Johnson maybe?

content.description: There is a vine that runs down about half of the route.  Follow the finger crack to the top.  Negotiate through the vines to find the crack.
content.protection: finger sized gear   gear anchor up top
content.location: Route located ten feet left of Pointed Ears Left.  Start directly under the vines.

content.description: This is a wonderful place to hideout if the park is swarming with tourists.  The hideout is located between "Tower of the Gods" and "Seasame Street Rocks"  The area sees little sunshine so it is usually too damp to climb after a good rain.  Fall/Spring are ideal times to climb here.
